Persona: topics rather

Persona: because data analysis was not fun enough or overall because not much human connection in front of the screen? Persona: My prev. job was translating SoMe texts from English to Lithuanian. I am just disgusted by the thought of it now, I could not focus, I kept checking phone every 5 mins, etc. But when it comes to programming, I literally forget other ppl exist, time passes instantly.

Friend: also I cannot be left alone for too long or my brain switches from outward mode to inward mode, and I get very weird very quickly haha. I kind of forget how to be a person
Friend: aaah I don't know. still not convinced. I trust no one in this world more than my gut instinct, but still think it's important to gather as much data as possible first, then do what feels right

Persona: Now I think that maybe I stopped that AI pong because I ran out of unique impressions from other people xd
Persona: this I totally get. It might be paradigm in the world about coding, data science and nerdy things. I really god damn want to find all the needed evidence to break this belief, but I am not getting close to this

They just never stop interacting. The engineers only talk to each other. Most of them never show up to friday bars and the one guy that does, he is like the cool engineer dude, I can still see that he is lonely sometimes in parties. I am in a position between both of them. And this position is so weird. So this might be an ultimate dilemma whether to pursue nerdy things or not
Persona: I just came back from my company retreat which held us in Sweden for a few days (and thus sorry for responding late, it was very intense) and I kept thinking about being inward and outward at the same time. I spent my holiday very inward and I am semi-inward at work and then tried to be outward but I can't just switch instantly and I had a bad experience.
Persona: Wonder if you thats also how you felt

Persona: But basically, gathering as much data as possible before taking action is very costly and I would say you still can't eliminate all risk.
Persona: And sometimes taking a bit of action, even if its a wrong one, can reveal so much more and get you deeper knowledge faster than research.
Persona: Of course if one is making million dollar decisions, then each extra knowledge might be worth it. Thats why I say learning to use gut feeling is more relevant for startup founders. And speed, non-bureaucracy, little administrative burden is a big advantage of startups.
Persona: Another kind of related thing is that (generally) the more failed startups one experiences, the higher the chance that the next will be better. So perhaps it's better to fail two startups in three years and learn so much for the third one, than spend multiple years looking for a perfect idea with no real-world experience.

I don't know if I belong everywhere or nowhere, but I guess it is what it is

Friend: hahah, yes. it feels like I'm in some sort of a locked in syndrome. my brain is happy to finally encounter some people, but cannot remember for shit how a conversation works

Friend: I've just realized that we have different types of choices in mind. I was thinking more generally, and you're referring specifically to business decisions. when I make big decisions, they usually concern the important turns in the trajectory of my own life, so my most precious resource is time. cannot really afford to lose too much of that. but when it comes to money and other renewable things, yeah, I think it's easier to just fuck around and learn from experience (I know you still invest and lose time here, but I guess it's not the main concern)

Persona: If I could give it some more time, i am sure I would
Persona: then they are doing smth wrong.  if they are socially akward, then atleast they should make it worth being
Persona: talk at you - smart way you said it. I dont know if I feel the same, for be its like animal making sounds - they just play their default sound all the time which is talking. At once I actually felt the same, idk how, but social interactions at work became sort of automatic to me. I would go to the coffee machine and I would not even realize that I am talking, and I would come up with such genius nice interactions without even having to think. And it made other people feel good. Then after, when leaving, I would wonder "how the hell did I make this conversation"

Friend: what do you mean?
Friend: hahah this does sound exactly like the inner monologue I would expect a sales person to have
Persona: When one makes it big in life through STEM with the trade-off of being socially akward, then atleast it was worth it. If one is just socially akward without making it big, then why? Would better be social and enjoy the life seen in movies.
Persona: I would low-key like to be like the technical co-founder billionaires, who got a lot of money being nerdy and now they are super rich but awkward. Yet, when you have big money to spend you have a social life in easy mode.
Persona: I gotta tell you its a nice feeling. But I remember even when I had this mysterious abilitiy, it ceased to activate when work time ended. So for example when its 17 o' clock and the friday bar opens, I no longer have automatic conversations. Perhaps because I feel the pressure to do it.
Friend: waittt, let me finish responding to the previous one
Friend: is that so? in hindsight, with people from mine we were quite good at sensing whether the other person wants to talk and adjust accordingly. I think that was nice. tough it probably would be awkward not to talk in a shared flat for example
Persona: okay
Persona: no worries haha

Friend: you know, being socially awkward is not exactly a choice 😅
